results.title: Lessons in living
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Dallas Jones Production, Bill MacDonald and Edith Spencer
results.brief_description: The community of Lantzville, British Columbia, is a cross-section of nationalities and industrial groups - farmers, fishermen, lumbermen and railroad workers. Its spirit and its public school were down at the heels, but both community and school were transformed. An adjoining barn was converted into a community hall for the parents, to serve at the same time as a school gymnasium and as a workshop for the farm mechanics class. With the improved building, the whole school program was broadened.

results.title: Less stress
results.brief_description: Explains what stress is, and how it affects the body and its ability to function. Dramatic vignettes show ways to reduce stress caused by fear, conflict, school work, noise and peer pressure.

results.title: Less hours working
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Sue Mogg and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Examines the relevance and value of further education to Australia’s farming community to help them utilise and understand technological developments, changing government policies and increasing costs.

results.title: Leslie's cube
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and MGM International Films
results.brief_description: The radiation of heat of various substances is illustrated with standard equipment. Hot water is poured into a cube adjacent to a horizontal thermometer. This cube has faces of different materials and each face is presented to the thermometer in turn. The resulting rates of rise and fall in temperature registered on the thermometer are noted.

results.title: Lesley
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Elisabeth Knight and Keith Gow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
A drama based on a real life story, about a runaway girl and an uncaring mother. The film explores the duties of parents to protect their children from danger. Examines the rights of magistrates and judges to control a child’s environment for what is seen to be the child’s benefit. Director of Photography: John Seale

results.title: Lesbian Vampires = Vampyros Lesbos
results.creator_credit: Telecine, Fenix Cooperative Cinematografica, Hispano-Allemande, Karl Heinz Mannchen and Jesus Franco
results.brief_description: Amidst psychedelic keyboard and sitar music comes the erotic horror story of a powerful lesbian vampire (Soledad Miranda). Linda (Ewa Stromberg), a lawyer, is having potent and erotic dreams that she can’t explain. Her work sends her to a small island where she meets the force behind her dreams and her life is taken over by the rule of the dark spirit world. Does she have the will to resist? Will her boyfriend and sympathetic psychiatrist get to her in time? A cult classic from the director of “Female Vampire”. Cast includes Susann Korda, Dennis Price, Paul Muller.

results.title: Les Zozos = the Deceivers
results.creator_credit: Albina du Boisrouvray and Pascal Thomas
results.brief_description:
In 1962, two teenage boys spend their weeks in a boarding school in a provincial town. They horse around, playing pranks, roughhousing with each other and climbing over the school’s walls to harass and tease the local girls. Their main interest in life is women; anything to do with them is pleasing to them. They scrape together the money for a trip to Sweden, and despite more difficulties than they anticipated, one of them succeeds in making love with a girl.

Credits: Producer, Albina du Boisrouvray ; director, Pascal Thomas ; writers, Pascal Thomas, Roland Duval ; photography, Colin Mounier ; music, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Frederic Duru, Edmond Raillard, Jean-Marc Chollet, Daniel Ceccaldi, Serge Rousseau, Jacques Debary, Virginie Thevenet.

results.title: Les Yeux Fermes = the Eyes Closed
results.brief_description:
Ivan returns from touring with a theatre company. During the tour one of Ivan’s friend died. Back in Paris, Ivan experiences vision toubles and buys a pair of black glasses. From then on, he starts pretending to be a blind man. His girlfriend Xenie witnesses helplessly the slow march towards madness of a ‘blind’ man whose only markers are noises and memories..

Credits: Director, Joel Santoni ; writer, Jeanne Bronner, Joel Santoni, Claude Breuer ; photography, Pierre-William Glenn ; music, Terry Riley.
Cast: Gerard Desarthe, Lorraine Rainer, Jean Carmet, Marcel Dalio, Lucien Raimbourg.

results.title: Les Voyages de Marco Polo
results.brief_description:
Episode 12 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
This episode covers the expansion of the Mongol Empire with Gengis Khan and then his grand son, Kublai Khan. Niccolo and Maffeo Polo, two Venitian merchants reach the court of the Great Khan. When they return to Europe as Kublai’s ambassadors to the pope, they are charged with letters asking the pope to send Kublai one hundred intelligent men ‘acquainted with the Seven Arts’. They are asked to bring back some oil from the lamp burning at the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem. On their second journey, they take along their nephew Marco who was to stay at the Khan’s court for 20 years and recount his adventure in a book ‘Il Milione’.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Les Visiteurs du Soir = the Devil's Envoys
results.brief_description:
The film is based on the 15th century French legend, wherein the Devil, disturbed by the encroaching forces of Good, sends his envoys to Earth to drive the citizens to despair. Dominique and Gilles appear at the court of Baron Hugues disguised as troubadours on the day Hugues celebrates the engagement of his daughter Anne to Renaud. Dominique seduces the Baron and persuades him to kill Renaud during a tournament. But Gilles and Anne fall in love. Furious to see his scheme thwarted by true love, the devil himself decides to intervene. Note: The antisemitic laws of the Vichy regime made it illegal for Trauner and Kosma (regular members of Carne’s crew) to work in the film industry. Their work on this film is uncredited. Francois Chaumette, Simone Signoret, Alain Resnais and Jean-Pierre Mocky appear as extras.

Credits: Producer, Andre Paulve ; director, Marcel Carne ; writers, Jacques Prevert, Pierre Laroche ; photography, Roger Hubert ; music, Joseph Kosma, Maurice Thiriet ; art direction, Alexandre Trauner, Georges Wakhevitch, Leon Barsacq.
Cast: Arletty, Alain Cuny, Marie Dea, Jules Berry, Fernand Ledoux, Marcel Herrand, Roger Blin, Jean d’Yd.
